title: How to Attach Photos in Gmail

steps.headline: Open Gmail.
steps.description: Tap the Gmail app, which is white with a red "M" on it, to open Gmail. If you're already logged in on your phone or tablet, Gmail will open to your inbox. If you aren't logged in, enter your Gmail email address and password to continue.

steps.headline: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.description: You'll see this in the lower-right side of the screen. Doing so opens the New Message window.

steps.headline: Compose your email's text.
steps.description: Enter your recipient's email address in the "To" field, add a subject in the "Subject" field (optional), and type in your email's body text in the "Compose email" field.

steps.headline: Tap the paperclip icon.
steps.description: It's in the upper-right corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Select a photo to upload.
steps.description: Tap a photo from one of the albums at the bottom of the screen. You can also tap and hold a photo to select it and then tap more photos to select them as well. If you're adding multiple photos at once, tap INSERT in the top-right corner of the screen before continuing.

steps.headline: Tap the "Send" arrow.
steps.description: It's the paper plane-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen. This will send your email, photos and all, to your recipient.

steps.headline: Open Gmail.
steps.description: Go to https://www.gmail.com/ in your preferred web browser. This will open your Gmail inbox if you're already logged into Gmail on your computer. If you aren't logged in, click Sign In and enter your email address and password.

steps.headline: Click COMPOSE.
steps.description: This button is on the left side of the inbox, just below the "Gmail" heading. A blank email form will appear on the right side of the inbox.

steps.headline: Compose your email's text.
steps.description: Enter your recipient's email address in the "To" field, add a subject in the "Subject" field (optional), and type in your email's body text in the blank field below the "Subject" area.

steps.headline: Click the paperclip icon.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the "New Message" window. This will bring up a window from which you can add files that are on your computer. If you would prefer to attach a photo from Google Drive, instead click the triangular Google Drive icon.

steps.headline: Select a photo to upload.
steps.description: Go to the location on your computer where the photo is stored, then double-click it. To upload multiple photos, hold down the Control key and click each photo you want to upload, then click Open.

steps.headline: Click Send.
steps.description: It's in the bottom-left corner of the New Message window. This will send your email--and the attached photos--to your recipient.

text: On Mobile Open Gmail. Tap the Gmail app, which is white with a red "M" on it, to open Gmail. If you're already logged in on your phone or tablet, Gmail will open to your inbox. If you aren't logged in, enter your Gmail email address and password to continue. Tap the pencil icon. You'll see this in the lower-right side of the screen. Doing so opens the New Message window. Compose your email's text. Enter your recipient's email address in the "To" field, add a subject in the "Subject" field (optional), and type in your email's body text in the "Compose email" field. Tap the paperclip icon. It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. Select a photo to upload. Tap a photo from one of the albums at the bottom of the screen. You can also tap and hold a photo to select it and then tap more photos to select them as well. If you're adding multiple photos at once, tap INSERT in the top-right corner of the screen before continuing. Tap the "Send" arrow. It's the paper plane-shaped icon in the top-right corner of the screen. This will send your email, photos and all, to your recipient. On Desktop Open Gmail. Go to https://www.gmail.com/ in your preferred web browser. This will open your Gmail inbox if you're already logged into Gmail on your computer. If you aren't logged in, click Sign In and enter your email address and password. Click COMPOSE. This button is on the left side of the inbox, just below the "Gmail" heading. A blank email form will appear on the right side of the inbox. Compose your email's text. Enter your recipient's email address in the "To" field, add a subject in the "Subject" field (optional), and type in your email's body text in the blank field below the "Subject" area. Click the paperclip icon. It's at the bottom of the "New Message" window. This will bring up a window from which you can add files that are on your computer. If you would prefer to attach a photo from Google Drive, instead click the triangular Google Drive icon. Select a photo to upload. Go to the location on your computer where the photo is stored, then double-click it. To upload multiple photos, hold down the Control key and click each photo you want to upload, then click Open. Click Send. It's in the bottom-left corner of the New Message window. This will send your email--and the attached photos--to your recipient.
